title: Noem uses state aircraft for political events violating state law
summary: Governor Kristi Noem used state airplanes to travel to political events hosted by organizations including the National Rifle Association and Republican Jewish Coalition, violating South Dakota law that bars state aircraft from being used for anything other than state business. Democratic lawmakers sought investigation, but the ethics board ultimately dismissed the complaint due to unclear legal definitions of 'state business'.

sources.title: Ethics board says South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem may have engaged in misconduct
